content: Commuter Bike Lane App
A mobile app that uses crowdsourcing to identify and map the best routes for biking to work, highlighting bike lanes, safety features, and obstacles to avoid.
real-time crowd-sourced info, voice-guided navigation, route comparisons, safety alerts, bike-friendly business directory
Google Maps, Strava, Ride with GPS, MapMyRide, Komoot
Focuses exclusively on bike commuting, empowers users to contribute to the app's data and community
Bike Lane Advocacy

A consulting service that helps bike commuters organize and advocate for better biking infrastructure in their communities, including lobbying local government, raising awareness, and improving communications between bikers and drivers.
advocacy strategy, community organizing, lobbying expertise, social media marketing, event planning
People for Bikes, League of American Bicyclists, Alliance for Biking & Walking, Bike Pittsburgh, Bike Austin
Specializes in bike commuting issues, works directly with local residents and governments, focus on practical and achievable goals
On-Demand Bike Repair
A mobile bike repair service that comes to a bike commuter's workplace, home, or a convenient location, offering tune-ups, repairs, and maintenance during working hours.
mobile repair shop, pick-up and drop-off service, certified mechanics, on-site assembly, bike fitting
Velofix, Beeline Bikes, Bike Doctor, The Mobile Bike Man, Mobile Bicycle Service
Specializes in serving busy bike commuters, offers hassle-free and convenient service, competitive prices
Bike-Friendly Employer Certification

A certification program that helps companies and organizations become more bike-friendly, including offering incentives, amenities, and support for bike commuters, such as secure bike storage, showers, and changing rooms.
needs assessment, program development, employee engagement, marketing and promotion, evaluation and feedback

League of American Bicyclists' Bicycle Friendly Business program, Eco-Counter, Commute Seattle's Bike-Friendly Workplace program, Bicycle Colorado's Workplace Certification program, Silicon Valley Bicycle Coalition's Bicycle Friendly Workplace program
Focuses exclusively on bike commuters and their unique needs, offers customized solutions, and provides ongoing support and feedback
pain_point_description: lack of proper bike lanes, traffic safety measures, and bike-friendly workplaces make it difficult for commuters to safely and conveniently bike to work
